title: Home and Away star Ben Steel says focusing on suicide rates in the entertainment world saved him
text:
Former soap star star Ben Steel went from one of Australia's hottest heart throbs to a man crippled by depression, but a personal project saved his life.

The Australian actor played the role of Jude Lawson on Home And Away in the early 2000s, where he enjoyed a successful career until he felt it began to fall apart.

Ben, now 43, began making the documentary The Show Must Go On three years ago when he was extremely depressed.

'I was at the point where I wanted to kill myself': Home and Away star Ben Steel (pictured) said on Friday that that making a documentary on the shocking rates of suicide in the entertainment world saved his life

'I was on the brink of suicide,' Ben told The Daily Telegraph.

'I was at the point where I wanted to kill myself. I felt like things within my professional and personal life weren't where I wanted them to be.'

Ben said his documentary highlights to rates of suicide attempts those in the entertainment business endure which are roughly double the national average.

Tragic end: Ben Unwin became the latest Home and Away actor to tragically lose their lives. Ben was found dead on 14 August at the bottom of Minyon Falls near Byron Bay. He was 41

The documentary took three years to make and involves the likes of Shane Jacobson, Sam Neill, Michala Banas and David McAlliste.

'It is through doing this that I realised I wasn't alone and that there was a way out. Through talking to people, getting support and counselling, I ultimately got the help that I needed and could see a different way out,' he said.

Ben said he now feels better equipped to take on the negatives in life.

Heartbreaking: On January 6, model Annalise Braakensiek was found dead in her inner-city Sydney apartment after police were alerted by her close friends and family. She was 46

It comes as his co-star Ben Unwin recently became the latest Home and Away actor to tragically lose their lives.

Ben was found dead on 14 August at the bottom of Minyon Falls near Byron Bay. He was 41.

On January 6, model and former Home and Away star Annalise Braakensiek was found dead in her inner-city Sydney apartment after police were alerted by her close friends and family. She was 46.

The Show Must Go On airs on the ABC at 9.30pm on Tuesday.

For confidential support in Australia, call Lifeline on 13 11 14.
